docs.lead_paragraph: IT is a problem that people are often embarrassed to say they have, but an estimated 20 to 30 million Americans, mostly women, suffer from some form of incontinence. Dr. David S. Breslin, a urologist and surgeon, says many of them can be helped. Dr. Breslin, a resident of Scarsdale, completed a fellowship in female urology, incontinence and urodynamics at Harvard Medical School and Beth Israel Hospital. He is an assistant clinical professor in the Department of Urology at New York Medical College in Valhalla and has his office in Peekskill. Here are excerpts from a recent conversation with him:

headline.main: Westchester Q&A: Dr. David S. Breslin;Treating an Embarrassing Ailment
